items.title: 'Torres-like' Ekitike haunts long-term admirers Newcastle
items.summary: Newcastle United needed no reminding of Hugo Ekitike's quality after trying to sign him last summer - and the Liverpool striker haunted his former suitors at Anfield on Saturday.

items.title: Hennessy edges win over Boutell for eighth-straight victory
items.summary: Francesca Hennessy claims her eighth-straight victory as she beats Ellie Bouttell on points at London's Copper Box Arena.

items.title: How West Ham collapse at Chelsea led to mass brawl
items.summary: Match of the Day pundit Shay Given breaks down how West Ham's frustration in their loss against Chelsea, after being two goals ahead, led to an on the pitch scuffle and Jean-Clair Todibo seeing red.

items.title: How Ekitike is becoming Liverpool's star man
items.summary: Match of the Day pundits Steph Houghton and Shay Given discuss how Hugo Ekitike has become Liverpool's star striker, as his chemistry with summer signing Florian Wirtz has emerged.

items.title: Woad eight shots off lead after play suspended in Orlando
items.summary: Lottie Woad falls eight shots behind the lead at the Tournament of Champions after blustery conditions in Orlando lead okay to be suspended.

items.title: Humphries hits nine-darter in World Masters win
items.summary: Luke Humphries hits a nine-darter on his way to victory in the last 16 of the World Masters, as world champion Luke Humphries also makes it through to the quarter-finals.

items.title: Bloodied Hennessy takes narrow win over Bouttell
items.summary: Francesca Hennessy stays unbeaten by narrowly defeating Ellie Bouttell in London.

items.title: Bale sends ball into crowd at Icons of Football tournament
items.summary: Gareth Bale sends the ball wayward in the Reignwood Icons of Football tournament in Bangkok.

items.title: 'Emotional' Murphy in German Masters trophy chase
items.summary: World number one Judd Trump will play Shaun Murphy in the German Masters final, with Murphy aiming to win a trophy named after his late friend.

items.title: Kelly outpoints Murtazaliev to win maiden world title
items.summary: Britain's Josh Kelly puts on a slick performance to beat Bakhram Murtazaliev and win the IBF light-middleweight title by majority decision in Newcastle.

items.title: Ekitike double helps Liverpool cruise past Newcastle
items.summary: Summer signing Huge Ekitike scores twice as Liverpool record their first league win of 2026, putting four goals past Newcastle United.

items.title: Chelsea fight back to beat West Ham in dramatic derby
items.summary: Chelsea come back from being two goals down at half-time to beat West Ham in stoppage time.

items.title: Kroupi scores stunner as Bournemouth beat Wolves
items.summary: 19-year-old Eli Juniour Kroupi scores his eight Premier League goal of the season to help Bournemouth beat Wolves 2-0.

items.title: Everton's Beto nets stoppage-time leveller at Brighton
items.summary: Beto celebrates his birthday by scoring in stoppage time for Everton to salvage a point in a hard-fought draw against Brighton.

items.title: Arsenal score four in superb win against Leeds
items.summary: Arsenal get their title charge back on track with a dominant display against Leeds, their first win in four Premier League games.

items.title: Klopp urged me to take Man City assistant job - Lijnders
items.summary: Pep Lijnders says former Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp urged him to take the job as Pep Guardiola's assistant coach at Manchester City.

items.title: Mateta agrees AC Milan move - Sunday's gossip
items.summary: Crystal Palace striker Jean-Philippe Mateta agrees a contract with AC Milan, Fulham have a Â£20m offer for Joe Willock rejected by Newcastle, plus more.

items.title: Hennessy digs deep to beat Bouttell on points
items.summary: British bantamweight Francesca Hennessy moves closer to a world title shot but has to dig deep for a tough points win over Ellie Bouttell.

items.title: Genius or obvious? Rosenior's subs inspire Chelsea comeback win
items.summary: After Chelsea's first comeback win from two goals down in a Premier League match, were Liam Rosenior's substitutions against West Ham genius or obvious?

items.title: Why Motherwell's Maswanhise is Scotland's hottest property
items.summary: BBC Scotland looks at the rise of Motherwell's Tawanda Maswanhise this season.

items.title: Ospreys wing Giles scores at death to deny Dragons
items.summary: Keelan Giles is the last-gasp hero as Ospreys edge out Dragons in a United Rugby Championship thriller in Bridgend.

items.title: Moyes defiant after being booked for celebration
items.summary: Everton manager David Moyes criticises the laws of the game after being booked for sprinting onto the pitch to celebrate Beto's last-gasp equaliser at Brighton.

items.title: Bell scores superb try as Ulster hold off Cardiff
items.summary: Australia prop Angus Bell scores a superb solo try as Ulster defeat Cardiff 21-14 in the United Rugby Championship in Belfast.

items.title: Leinster come from behind to beat Edinburgh in URC
items.summary: Leinster prove too strong for Edinburgh in the URC as the Irish side come from behind to earn a bonus-point win.

items.title: 'A great headache' - can Madueke stake claim for Arsenal and England?
items.summary: The sight of Noni Madueke flying past defenders and putting dangerous crosses into the penalty will have been a welcome sight for Mikel Arteta.

items.title: We Asked Nutrition Experts For The Best Healthy Snacks At Costcoâ€”These Are Their Top Picks
items.summary: Easy grabs for busy days, gym bags, and desk drawers.

items.title: Lifespan may be 50% heritable, study suggests
items.summary: A new study suggests that lifespan might be 50% heritable â€” although for now, it's hard to know if the finding applies across diverse populations.

items.title: England level series with win against South Africa
items.summary: England level their three-game series with South Africa at 1-1 with a 61-49 win in front of a sellout crowd in Johannesburg.

items.title: Valieva back on the ice after four-year doping ban
items.summary: Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva is greeted by cheering fans as she returns to the ice in her home country after serving a four-year doping ban and being stripped of an Olympic gold medal.

items.title: Philadelphia 76ers' George given 25-game drug ban
items.summary: Philadelphia 76ers forward Paul George is suspended without pay for 25 games for violating the NBA's anti-drug programme.

items.title: Arsenal showed character and quality in win at Leeds - Arteta
items.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says he is pleased with the dominance, character and quality that his side showed in their 4-0 win over Leeds.

items.title: Ice hockey venue unfinished days before Winter Olympics
items.summary: Olympic organisers face a race against time to finish the new ice hockey arena in Milan - five days before the venue is due to host its first match.

items.title: Iraola hails 'incredible' goalscoring teenager Kroupi

items.title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
